private_information: cannot lift or place crates (requires hoist)
truck0.goal: Help transport crates between places to achieve the global stacking goals.

private_information: cannot lift or place crates (requires hoist)
truck1.goal: Help transport crates between places to achieve the global stacking goals.

private_information: can lift/putdown/load/unload crates with durations dependent on weight/power
hoist0.goal: Manipulate crates at depot0 and cooperate to achieve the global stacking goals.

private_information: can lift/putdown/load/unload crates with durations dependent on weight/power
hoist1.goal: Manipulate crates at depot1 and cooperate to achieve the global stacking goals.

private_information: can lift/putdown/load/unload crates with durations dependent on weight/power
hoist2.goal: Manipulate crates at depot2 and cooperate to achieve the global stacking goals.

private_information: can lift/putdown/load/unload crates with durations dependent on weight/power
hoist3.goal: Manipulate crates at distributor0 and cooperate to achieve the global stacking goals.

private_information: can lift/putdown/load/unload crates with durations dependent on weight/power
hoist4.goal: Manipulate crates at distributor1 and cooperate to achieve the global stacking goals.

private_information: can lift/putdown/load/unload crates with durations dependent on weight/power
hoist5.goal: Manipulate crates at distributor2 and cooperate to achieve the global stacking goals.

orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and problem to coordinate trucks and hoists to achieve the stacking goals while minimizing total time.

public_information: Trucks move between places with duration distance/speed
Hoists manipulate crates locally with durations dependent on weight and power
Crates can be on surfaces or in trucks
Hoists must be co-located to lift/put/load/unload crates
Distances are directed and specified in init.distances

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. You will be provided information about the environment and the capabilities and knowledge of the agents which interact in the environment. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that describes the planning problem. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions for different agents distinct, so that there is no confusion as to which agent performs which action.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
truck0 constraints: {agents->agent_details->truck0->private_information}.
truck1 constraints: {agents->agent_details->truck1->private_information}.
hoist0 constraints: {agents->agent_details->hoist0->private_information}.
hoist1 constraints: {agents->agent_details->hoist1->private_information}.
hoist2 constraints: {agents->agent_details->hoist2->private_information}.
hoist3 constraints: {agents->agent_details->hoist3->private_information}.
hoist4 constraints: {agents->agent_details->hoist4->private_information}.
hoist5 constraints: {agents->agent_details->hoist5->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
